abstract.text: A notification the system posts when an audio interruption occurs.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The notification’s user-information dictionary contains the
key. If the interruption type is
, the system interrupted your app’s audio session and it’s no longer active. If the interruption type is
for more information on using this notification.
The system posts this notification on the main thread.

Starting in iOS 10, the system deactivates an app’s audio session when it suspends the app process. When the app starts running again, it receives an interruption notification that the system has deactivated its audio session. This notification is necessarily delayed in time because the system can only deliver it once the app is running again. If the system suspended your app’s audio session for this reason, the user-information dictionary contains the
If you configured your audio session to be nonmixable (the default behavior for the

categories), deactivate your audio session if you’re not actively using audio when you go into the background. Doing so avoids having your audio session deactivated by the system (and receiving this somewhat confusing notification).

abstract.text: Play, record, and process audio; configure your app’s system audio behavior.
An object that communicates to the system how you intend to use audio in your app.
The category for routing distinct streams of audio data to different output devices at the same time.
The category for recording (input) and playback (output) of audio, such as for a Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) app.
The category for playing recorded music or other sounds that are central to the successful use of your app.
The default audio session category.
Constants that indicate the state of an audio session after an interruption.
Constants that define the reasons for an audio session interruption.
Constants that describe the type of an audio interruption.
A type that indicates that the operating system began interrupting the audio session.
A type that indicates that the operating system ended interrupting the audio session.
A notification the system posts when an audio interruption occurs.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the system interrupts the audio session when the active route disconnects.
A Boolean value that indicates a preference for not interrupting the session with system alerts.
Sets a preference to interrupt the audio session when the active route disconnects.
Sets the preference for not interrupting the audio session with system alerts.
A user info key to retrieve the interruption option.
A user info key to retrieve the interruption reason.
A user info key to retrieve the interruption type.
A user info key used to determine if the interruption is due to the audio session being deactivated when the system suspended the app.
Observe audio session notifications to ensure that your app responds appropriately to interruptions.
A true value.
A structure that defines the name of a notification.
An object containing information broadcast to registered observers that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.

value.text: A container for information broadcast through a notification center to all registered observers.
